metadata.title: CVE-2023-7192 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
[netfilter: ctnetlink: fix possible refcount leak inctnetlink_create_conntrack()]

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-7192` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-18-generic - 6.2.0-18.18
linux-image-6.2.0-18-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-18.18
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-18-generic - 6.2.0-18.18
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-18-generic-64k - 6.2.0-18.18
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1002-kvm - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-aws - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-azure - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1005-gcp - 6.2.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1002-lowlatency - 6.2.0-1002.2
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1002-lowlatency-64k - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-oracle - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi - 6.2.0-1004.5
linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 6.2.0-1004.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1002-starfive - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-18.18').
linux-kvm package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1002.2').
linux-allwinner: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support').
linux-aws package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1003.3').
linux-azure package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1003.3').
linux-gcp package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1005.5').
linux-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support, was needs-triage').
linux-lowlatency package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1002.2').
linux-oracle package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1003.3').
linux-raspi package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1004.5').
linux-starfive package in lunar is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '6.2.0-1002.2').
